sub_topic: Prove that the empty set is a subset of every set.
message_1: Let A be a set such that A = {2, 4, 6}. Determine whether the empty set Ø is a subset of set A or not. Justify your answer using the definition of subset in set theory.
message_2:
In set theory, a set B is considered a subset of a set A (denoted as B ⊆ A) if every element of B is also an element of A. In other words, if x ∈ B, then x ∈ A.

The empty set Ø is a set with no elements. By definition, there are no elements in Ø that are not in A, since there are no elements in Ø at all. Therefore, the empty set Ø is a subset of any set, including set A.

So, Ø ⊆ A, and the empty set is a subset of set A.
